alert.note: Alert for Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 29 at 7:04PM CST until February 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following counties, Conecuh, Covington and Crenshaw. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 703 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Andalusia, Opp, River Falls, Red Level, Dozier, Heath, Gantt, Straughn, Valley Of Shiloh, Dunns, Sanford, Coldwater, Rawls, Boston, Carolina, Rhump, Wiggins, Searight, Stanley and Eoda.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
